page.title: 08A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: The farmer is an early riser in order to milk the cows before breakfast. The milk is cooled in a bulk tank and collected daily by an MMB road tanker. After breakfast he will clean out the byre or milking parlour. In winter the farmer will feed any other livestock housed inside. After lunch other jobs need attention, mending fences, sawing logs and machinery servicing. Later in the afternoon the cows need milking again and the farmer is ready for supper. Later he will check his animals and in summer there is still work to do such as collecting hay, making silage or necessary repairs to buildings or equipment. And so to bed.
